title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: The whiff ay his aftershave and his big gravelly chin against ma skin is infantilisin. Then, when we get in the motor tae go along Ferry Road tae the do at the Ken Buchanan Hotel, my ma crushes my hand and sais, through a blindin mask ay tears, — You're ma wee baby now. Ah put it down tae grief talkin, but part ay me is thinkin: This woman is fucking insane, as resentment and tenderness battle inside me.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: 347 Matty's sayin how's he meant tae unload aw they boaxes oan his tod, but ah'm right staggerin like a wino up oantae the Ferry Road. Ah puke up n faw ower, hudin oantae the railins n this wifie n her bairn are askin us if ah'm awright, n ah pill masel up n walk a bit doon the road . . . then . . .

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: We're scramblin fir the dosh but Jesus fuck, thaire's a cop car pullin up, n two polis git oot, so we're offski, oor poakits laden wi change. We kin hear them radioing fir help, and we head doon Madeira Street, nashin ower Ferry Road, doon Largo Place, n the steps taewards the river, coins swingin n jinglin. One copper's goat back intae the motor, but one stocky cunt's fuckin well flyin eftir us as we hit the Water ay Leith walkway.
